list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Add plan management system with model and API integration
Introduced a new "Plan" model and API to manage subscription plans and their parameters. Added support for mapping model, workflow type, and workflow segment parameters, with validation for each. Updated the core application and various models to integrate the plan system, ensuring compatibility with existing components. Removed redundant server validation checks in `comfy_core`.

project.component: { "keyToString": { "ASKED_SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "Docker.docker-compose.yaml: Compose Deployment.executor": "Run", "FastAPI.art.executor": "Run", "Python tests.Python tests for test_user_handler.test_handle_user_webhook_unknown_type.executor": "Run", "Python tests.Python tests for test_user_handler.test_handle_user_webhook_user_created.executor": "Run", "Python tests.Python tests in test_user_handler.py.executor": "Coverage", "Python tests.Python tests in tests.executor": "Run", "Python tests.pytest for test_user_handler.executor": "Run", "Python.Worker.executor": "Run", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.TerminalTabsStorage.copyFrom.TerminalArrangementManager": "true", "RunOnceActivity.git.unshallow": "true", "SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "git-widget-placeholder": "feature/0.0.1", "ignore.virus.scanning.warn.message": "true", "junie.onboarding.icon.badge.shown": "true", "last_opened_file_path": "/home/pedro/PycharmProjects/o-art/model/map", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.detected.package.tslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "node.js.selected.package.tslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "run.code.analysis.last.selected.profile": "aDefault", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "reference.settings.ide.settings.file-colors", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" } }

task.summary: Default task

Add FastAPI app with image generation and infrastructure setup
Implemented a FastAPI app with an endpoint to generate images using a custom queue-based processing system. Added supporting files including `docker-compose.yaml` for infrastructure (Postgres, Redis, MinIO), a configuration file, and example HTTP tests. Initial project structure and dependencies were established, alongside IDE-specific configurations.

Add FastAPI app with image generation and infrastructure setup
Introduced a FastAPI application with endpoints for image generation, user authentication, and webhook processing using modular routers. Added Docker Compose configuration for supporting infrastructure (InfluxDB, Redis, MinIO, Postgres) and included configuration management and environment variable handling utilities. Enhanced the project with a user model, request validation, and InfluxDB integration for logging.

Refactor and enhance prompt handling and logging features
Refactored `comfy_core` to improve error handling, logging, and modularization for prompt execution and image generation. Introduced `logging_core` for centralized log management with rotation and cleanup. Updated `config.ini` and `config_core` to include logging configurations.

Refactor to modularize and enhance database and logging setup
Separated database, logging, and InfluxDB functionalities into dedicated modules under the `core` directory for better organization and reusability. Updated user model with UUIDs and timestamps while introducing `User` as the primary table. Replaced the utility-based `metric_core` with an OOP-based `InfluxDBWriter` class to improve maintainability.

Add user webhook handling and database interaction logic
Introduced a `handle_user_webhook` function to process user-related webhooks and store user data in the database. Updated the `User` model with utility methods for database insertion and logging improvements. Refactored database session handling and included webhook type enumeration for better structure and scalability.

Refactor handlers and APIs, add tests for user webhooks
Refactored user handling logic to support CRUD operations for webhooks. Updated `Config` to dynamically determine the configuration file path. Split `/generate` route into a dedicated `image_api` module. Added comprehensive tests for user webhook handlers.

Add WebSocket support and optimize queue handling logic
Introduced a WebSocket API for real-time queue updates and adjusted queue filtering for better efficiency. Refactored authentication handler logic and enhanced image generation API with token-based user identification. Updated dependencies and removed redundant code for improved maintainability.

Add InfluxDB metrics and refactor image generation logic
Introduced InfluxDB metrics tracking in the `check_queue` function to monitor queue status. Refactored image generation to use a dedicated handler, improving structure and readability. Also added a background task for queue monitoring during app startup.

Integrate Celery for queue handling and enhance logging setup
Replaced manual queue checks with Celery for distributed task management, including worker and beat processes. Introduced Redis configuration support and updated the logging system to ensure UTF-8 encoding consistency. Adjusted main application lifecycle management to handle worker/beat subprocesses and improved log cleanup logic for better reliability.

Add workflow execution logic and enhance image generation API.
Introduced a modular workflow execution system for ComfyUI, replacing static prompts with dynamic, parameterized workflows. Updated API to validate and handle user-specified workflows with error handling. Streamlined image generation logic into reusable functions, supporting placeholders in workflows for customization and flexibility.

Update .gitignore to exclude Celery beat schedule files
Added `celerybeat-schedule.bak`, `.dat`, and `.dir` to `.gitignore` to prevent versioning of Celery beat schedule files. This ensures unnecessary local files are not tracked in the repository.

Add Dockerfile, enhance config management, and logging
Introduce a new Dockerfile for containerization. Rework configuration handling to include better fallback and validation mechanisms, including default values for critical settings. Improve logging infrastructure with enhanced error handling, log rotation, and configuration-driven parameters. Added Celery setup in requirements and adjusted docker-compose services for robust service dependency management.

Refactor user and ComfyUI handlers to improve modularity and error handling
Revised user management to utilize service layer for create, update, and delete operations. Enhanced error handling and logging in ComfyUI workflows and improved maintainability by refactoring shared components. Applied input validations and adjusted datetime handling for consistency across the codebase.

"Refactor logging and add log cleanup logic"
Revised logging setup to support configuration-driven parameters and improve modularity. Added a log cleanup mechanism to manage log file retention based on configurable limits. Enhanced error handling in logging and log cleanup functions for better reliability and maintainability.

Add .pylintrc configuration file to disable specific checks
This configuration disables docstring and naming checks to streamline linting for the current codebase. It also sets a minimum score threshold of 8.0 and outputs results in JSON format.

Refactor user webhook handling and improve workflow execution.
Refactored user webhook processing for better readability and fixed inconsistent logging. Adjusted workflow execution functions in `comfy_core` to enhance error handling, add missing validations, and clean up logging statements. Removed duplicated logic and addressed minor formatting issues across files.

Standardize formatting and fix indentations in codebase
Improved code readability by standardizing formatting, fixing inconsistent indentations, and removing unnecessary imports. These changes ensure better code style adherence and maintainability without altering functionality.

Simplify logging statements and remove unused code.
Replaced formatted string literals with standardized logging placeholders across the codebase to improve consistency and clarity in log messages. Additionally, removed the unused `cleanup_old_logs` function from `logging_core.py` to reduce dead code.

Update .pylintrc to include import-error in ignored rules
Added import-error to the list of ignored pylint rules to prevent unnecessary warnings related to imports. This ensures smoother linting for cases where imports may fail due to environment-specific configurations.

Refactor logging and add log cleanup utility.
Replaced f-strings in logging calls with parameterized log messages for consistency and efficiency. Added a `cleanup_old_logs` function to manage log file retention, ensuring only the most recent logs are retained.

Use placeholders in log messages to enhance consistency
Replaced f-strings with placeholder-based logging across the codebase to improve performance and ensure consistency. This approach defers string formatting until log messages are actually emitted, conforming to best practices for logging in Python.

"Standardize logging and fix formatting issues
Replaced f-strings with parameterized logging for consistency and performance improvements. Fixed inconsistencies in indentation, formatting, and unused imports for better code readability and maintainability."

Refactor and clean up codebase for consistency and readability
Applied formatting improvements across multiple modules to enhance code consistency and readability. Resolved redundant logic, improved exception handling, and adhered to best practices in method and error definitions. Also added PyLint and Ruff configuration files for static analysis support.

Refactor imports across modules for consistency
Reorganized imports to align with PEP 8 guidelines by grouping standard library, third-party, and local module imports. Addressed unused or redundant imports, ensuring improved readability and maintainability.

"Refactor logging and formatting across multiple modules.
Standardized logging by replacing f-strings with parameterized log messages for improved performance and consistency. Improved code readability by fixing formatting issues, including line breaks, indentation, and redundant logic. Updated configurations to enhance maintainability and enforced better logging practices."

Use modern `dict` type hints across the codebase
Replaced `Dict` type hints with modern `dict` syntax for improved consistency and readability. This change aligns with Python 3.9+ typing conventions and simplifies type annotations throughout the project. Updated multiple files to adhere to this standard.

Fix dependency function calls by removing redundant parentheses
Removed unnecessary parentheses from `Depends(auth.authenticated)` in `image_api.py` and `auth_api.py`. This fixes potential issues with function injection and aligns with FastAPI's expected usage.

Fix redundant parentheses in dependency injection calls
Removed unnecessary parentheses from `Depends(auth.authenticated)` in `image_api.py` and `auth_api.py` to resolve potential issues with FastAPI's dependency injection. This change ensures alignment with FastAPI's expected usage and improves code readability. Additionally, restructured `load_dotenv()` placement for consistency across modules.

Add Workflow and Image models with enums and integrate into the project.
1. **`workflow_model.py`:** Added Workflow schema for database interactions. 2. **`image_model.py`:** Added Image schema with workflow and user relationships. 3. **Enums:** Created `Model`, `WorkflowType`, and `WorkflowSegment` for workflow and image classification. 4. **`main.py`:** Imported new models for database use. 5. **Fixes:** Corrected paths in JSON and `docker-compose.yaml`. 6. **IDE configs:** Updated IDE settings for Python SDK and consistent paths. 7. **`comfy_core.py`:** Removed redundant lines.

Remove unused workflow and JSON schema, add MinIO integration
Eliminated the outdated `Flux-SVDQ-base.json` workflow and introduced MinIO integration for handling image uploads. Enhanced project functionality by adding `model_model.py` for database schema, updated enums for consistent formatting, and improved various file handlers.

Refactor workflow handling and enhance error handling.
Replaced generic exceptions with FastAPI's `HTTPException` for improved error responses in `workflow_service.py`. Updated workflow logic to use UUIDs and adjusted image-related handlers accordingly. Simplified `.gitignore` and removed redundant workspace configurations.

Refactor image handling and improve workflow execution.
Streamlined workflow parameter validation, added image saving to MinIO buckets, and integrated a database for image metadata persistence. Introduced robust error handling, optimized seed generation, and enhanced modularity with a new `image_service.py`. Updated workflows JSON to include new "Flux Dev" workflow configuration.

Refactor workflow handling and enhance API structure.
Introduced error handling improvements with custom exceptions and better HTTP responses. Added WorkflowBase and WorkflowCreate models for reusability and streamlined the creation/update logic. Removed redundant files, cleaned up `.gitignore`, and refactored workflows API for improved clarity and modularity.

Migrate to async SQLAlchemy sessions and improve database handling.
Replaced synchronous `Session` with `AsyncSession` throughout the codebase to enable non-blocking database operations. Updated function signatures, adjusted workflow, user, and image models for consistent datetime handling, and refactored services for better async support. Improved error handling and logging for critical operations.

Update workflow API to support partial updates with patch.
Replaced `WorkflowCreate` with `WorkflowUpdate` for update operations, allowing partial updates of workflows. Adjusted the API route to use `PATCH` and updated the handler to accommodate the new model. Refactored related components to ensure compatibility with optional fields and unset values.

Add model management API with validation and CRUD operations
Introduced a new "model" API for handling models, including CRUD endpoints and database integration. Added validation for the "name" field in both models and workflows to ensure the field is not empty. Refactored related components, such as handlers and services, to support the new API and enhance functionality with proper error handling.

Add plan management system with model and API integration
Introduced a new "Plan" model and API to manage subscription plans and their parameters. Added support for mapping model, workflow type, and workflow segment parameters, with validation for each. Updated the core application and various models to integrate the plan system, ensuring compatibility with existing components. Removed redundant server validation checks in `comfy_core`.

Removed unnecessary parentheses from `Depends(auth.authenticated)` in `image_api.py` and `auth_api.py` to resolve potential issues with FastAPI's dependency injection. This change ensures alignment with FastAPI's expected usage and improves code readability. Additionally, restructured `load_dotenv()` placement for consistency across modules.

Create workflow and image models with supporting enums
Added Workflow and Image models, providing schema definitions for database operations. Introduced supporting enums (Model, WorkflowType, and WorkflowSegment) to categorize workflow types and related segments. Updated main.py and related configurations to integrate the models. Additionally, fixed paths and updated IDE settings for consistency.

Add workflow models and enums for database integration
Introduced new database models for workflows and images, along with enums for workflow types, segments, and model types. Updated `main.py` to include these models and adjusted related configurations and dependencies.

Add Workflow and Image models with enums and integrate into the project.
1. **`workflow_model.py`:** Added Workflow schema for database interactions. 2. **`image_model.py`:** Added Image schema with workflow and user relationships. 3. **Enums:** Created `Model`, `WorkflowType`, and `WorkflowSegment` for workflow and image classification. 4. **`main.py`:** Imported new models for database use. 5. **Fixes:** Corrected paths in JSON and `docker-compose.yaml`. 6. **IDE configs:** Updated IDE settings for Python SDK and consistent paths. 7. **`comfy_core.py`:** Removed redundant lines.

1. **`comfy/workflows/Flux-SVDQ-base.json`:** Removed obsolete workflow file. 2. **`model/workflow_model.py`:** Added `model_id` field for database relationship. 3. **`model/enum`:** Standardized enum values to uppercase for all workflow and model types. 4. **`handler/image_handler.py`:** Enhanced image processing by integrating MinIO for image uploads. 5. **`core/minio_core.py`:** Introduced MinIO utility functions for bucket and file operations. 6. **`requirements.txt`:** Added `minio` dependency for S3-compatible operations. 7. **`model/model_model.py`:** Added new database model for managing ML models. 8. **`.idea/workspace.xml`:** Updated IDE config for accuracy in commit message handling and project settings. 9. **`service/model_service.py`:** Added service to handle database operations for models.

Remove unused workflow and JSON schema, add MinIO integration
Eliminated the outdated `Flux-SVDQ-base.json` workflow and introduced MinIO integration for handling image uploads. Enhanced project functionality by adding `model_model.py` for database schema, updated enums for consistent formatting, and improved various file handlers.

Replaced generic exceptions with FastAPI's `HTTPException` for improved error responses in `workflow_service.py`. Updated workflow logic to use UUIDs and adjusted image-related handlers accordingly. Simplified `.gitignore` and removed redundant workspace configurations.

Streamlined workflow parameter validation, added image saving to MinIO buckets, and integrated a database for image metadata persistence. Introduced robust error handling, optimized seed generation, and enhanced modularity with a new `image_service.py`. Updated workflows JSON to include new "Flux Dev" workflow configuration.

Introduced error handling improvements with custom exceptions and better HTTP responses. Added WorkflowBase and WorkflowCreate models for reusability and streamlined the creation/update logic. Removed redundant files, cleaned up `.gitignore`, and refactored workflows API for improved clarity and modularity.

Replaced synchronous `Session` with `AsyncSession` throughout the codebase to enable non-blocking database operations. Updated function signatures, adjusted workflow, user, and image models for consistent datetime handling, and refactored services for better async support. Improved error handling and logging for critical operations.

Replaced `WorkflowCreate` with `WorkflowUpdate` for update operations, allowing partial updates of workflows. Adjusted the API route to use `PATCH` and updated the handler to accommodate the new model. Refactored related components to ensure compatibility with optional fields and unset values.

Add model management API with validation and CRUD operations
Introduced a new "model" API for handling models, including CRUD endpoints and database integration. Added validation for the "name" field in both models and workflows to ensure the field is not empty. Refactored related components, such as handlers and services, to support the new API and enhance functionality with proper error handling.

Add plan management system with model and API integration
Introduced a new "Plan" model and API to manage subscription plans and their parameters. Added support for mapping model, workflow type, and workflow segment parameters, with validation for each. Updated the core application and various models to integrate the plan system, ensuring compatibility with existing components. Removed redundant server validation checks in `comfy_core`.
